Package com.github.yellowstonegames.core

Class Interpolations.Interpolator

java.lang.Object
com.github.yellowstonegames.core.Interpolations.Interpolator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interpolations.InterpolationFunction
Enclosing class:
Interpolations
public static class Interpolations.Interpolator extends Object implements Interpolations.InterpolationFunction
A simple wrapper around an Interpolations.InterpolationFunction so it is associated with a String tag. This also implements InterpolationFunction, and wraps the fn it stores to clamp the output if the input is too low or too high.

  • Field Details

    • tag

      public final @NonNull String tag

    • fn

  • Constructor Details

    • Interpolator

      public Interpolator()
      Calls Interpolator(String, InterpolationFunction) with "linear" and Interpolations.linearFunction. Because Interpolations.linear is already registered with that tag and function, this isn't very useful.

    • Interpolator

      public Interpolator(@NonNull String tag, @NonNull Interpolations.InterpolationFunction fn)
      Creates an Interpolator that will use the given fn and registers it with the given tag. The tag must be unique; if Interpolations.get(String) returns a non-null value when looking up the given tag, then if you create an Interpolator with that tag, the existing value will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      tag - a unique String that can be used as a key to access this with Interpolations.get(String)
      fn - an Interpolations.InterpolationFunction to wrap

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public float apply(float alpha)
      Does bounds-checking on the input before passing it to fn. If alpha is less than, roughly, one-millionth, then this always returns 0; if alpha is greater than or equal to 1, this returns 1, and in any other case it delegates to fn.
      Specified by:
      apply in interface Interpolations.InterpolationFunction
      Parameters:
      alpha - almost always between 0 and 1, inclusive
      Returns:
      an interpolated value based on alpha, which may (for some functions) be negative, or greater than 1

    • getTag

      public @NonNull String getTag()
      Gets the tag for this Interpolator, which is a unique String that identifies this object. If another Interpolator tries to use the same tag, this Interpolator will be un-registered and will no longer be returnable from Interpolations.get(String).
      Returns:
      the tag String

    • getFn

      public @NonNull Interpolations.InterpolationFunction getFn()
      Gets the InterpolationFunction this actually uses to do its math work. Calling this function on its own does not behave the same way as calling apply(float) on this Interpolator; the Interpolator method clamps the result if the alpha parameter is below 0 or above 1.
      Returns:
      the InterpolationFunction this uses
